Module Contents¶

models.db[source]¶
class models.Task[source]¶

Bases: db

This class represents the Task entity in the database, storing details about tasks such as description, points, deadline, and timestamps for creation and updates.

Why: Useful for tracking individual tasks, allowing applications to store, retrieve, and manage task details effectively.

How: Common usage examples: 1. Task.query.all(): Retrieve all tasks. 2. Task.query.filter_by(task_id=1).first(): Retrieve a specific task by ID.

__tablename__ = 'task'[source]¶
task_id[source]¶

Unique identifier for each task.

description[source]¶

Text description of the task.

points[source]¶

Points assigned to the task for tracking effort or priority.

deadline[source]¶

Deadline date for task completion.

created_on[source]¶

Timestamp for when the task was created.

updated_on[source]¶

Timestamp for when the task was last updated.

created_by[source]¶

ID of the user who created the task, linking to the User entity.

__table_args__[source]¶
class models.Assignment[source]¶

Bases: db

This class represents the Assignment entity in the database, storing task assignments and tracking progress for each task assigned to users.

Why: Facilitates assignment management by linking tasks to users and tracking their progress, enabling task delegation and monitoring.

How: Common usage examples: 1. Assignment.query.filter_by(user_id=1).all(): Retrieve all assignments for a user. 2. Assignment.query.filter_by(assignment_id=1).first(): Retrieve a specific assignment by task ID.

__tablename__ = 'assignment'[source]¶
user_id[source]¶

Foreign key linking to the User table, representing the user assigned to the task.

assignment_id[source]¶

Primary key linking to the Task table, representing the assigned task.

progress[source]¶

Progress of the assignment, where 1.0 represents completion.

assignment_created_on[source]¶

Timestamp for when the assignment was created.

assignment_updated_on[source]¶

Timestamp for when the assignment was last updated.

class models.User[source]¶

Bases: db

This class represents the User entity in the database, storing user information such as unique Slack user IDs.

Why: Essential for linking tasks and assignments to specific users, enabling personalized tracking and Slack integration.

How: Common usage examples: 1. User.query.filter_by(slack_user_id=”U12345”).first(): Retrieve a user by Slack ID. 2. User.query.all(): Retrieve all users.

__tablename__ = 'user'[source]¶
user_id[source]¶

Unique identifier for each user.

slack_user_id[source]¶

Unique Slack ID for the user, enabling Slack-specific interactions.

__table_args__[source]¶

Slackpoints
